mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Richard Sprigg, 1787 September 28
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington informs a friend, Richard Sprigg, that he is sending back two of Sprigg’s jennies (female donkeys), which were mated with Royal Gift, a jackass sent to Washington by the King of Spain. Washington assures Sprigg that the Jennies “will prove with foal,” as “Royal Gift never fails.” Breeding livestock was one of Washington’s many agricultural interests. Autograph letter signed, 1 page, with integral cover.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Domestic animals
Livestock
